para.sentence: For the functions J , Y , I , and K see §§10.2(ii), 10.25(ii).

subsection.title: Power-Series in \epsilon for the Regular Solution

para.sentence: f\left(\epsilon,\ell;r\right)=\sum_{k=0}^{\infty}\epsilon^{k}{\sf F}_{k}(\ell; r), where {\sf F}_{k}(\ell;r)=\sum_{p=2k}^{3k}(2r)^{(p+1)/2}C_{k,p}J_{2\ell+1+p}\left( \sqrt{8r}\right), if r>0, {\sf F}_{k}(\ell;r)=\sum_{p=2k}^{3k}(-1)^{\ell+1+p}(2|r|)^{(p+1)/2}C_{k,p}I_{2 \ell+1+p}\left(\sqrt{8|r|}\right), if r<0.

The functions J and I are as in §§10.2(ii),10.25(ii),and the coefficients C_{k,p} are given by C_{0,0}=1 , C_{1,0}=0 , and C_{k,p}=0, if p<2k or p>3k, //// C_{k,p}=\left(-(2\ell+p)C_{k-1,p-2}+C_{k-1,p-3}\right)/(4p), if k>0, 2k\leq p\leq 3k.
The series (33.20.3)converges for all r and \epsilon.

subsection.title: Asymptotic Expansion for the Irregular Solution

para.sentence: As \epsilon\to 0 with \ell and r fixed, h\left(\epsilon,\ell;r\right)\sim-A(\epsilon,\ell)\sum_{k=0}^{\infty}\epsilon^ {k}{\sf H}_{k}(\ell;r), where A(\epsilon,\ell) is given by (33.14.11), (33.14.12), and {\sf H}_{k}(\ell;r)=\sum_{p=2k}^{3k}(2r)^{(p+1)/2}C_{k,p}Y_{2\ell+1+p}\left( \sqrt{8r}\right), if r>0, {\sf H}_{k}(\ell;r)=(-1)^{\ell+1}\frac{2}{\pi}\sum_{p=2k}^{3k}(2|r|)^{(p+1)/2} C_{k,p}K_{2\ell+1+p}\left(\sqrt{8|r|}\right), if r<0.
The functions Y and K are as in §§10.2(ii),10.25(ii),and the coefficients C_{k,p} are given by (33.20.6).

For a comprehensive collection of asymptotic expansions that cover f\left(\epsilon,\ell;r\right) and h\left(\epsilon,\ell;r\right) as \epsilon\to 0\pm and are uniform in r , including unbounded values, seeCurtis (1964a, §7).
These expansions are in terms of elementary functions, Airy functions, and Bessel functions of orders 2\ell+1 and 2\ell+2.
